xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 20 June 2013
xwikidoc.content: <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 07:00 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 07:01 <bvancea> hello mcupak 07:01 <bvancea> hello sdumitriu :) 07:01 <mcupak> hey 07:02 <bvancea> how it going? 07:02 <bvancea> I guess the mentors aren't up yet 07:04 <mcupak> i'm fine, how are you? 07:04 <mcupak> yeah, I don't think anybody is here yet 07:04 <bvancea> pretty good 11:01 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 12:04 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 12:04 <bvancea> hey sdumitriu 12:04 <sdumitriu1> Hey 12:05 <bvancea> apparently brian can't make it today 12:05 <bvancea> should we reschedule? 12:06 <bvancea> or just have it the 2 of us 12:08 <sdumitriu1> Just us 12:08 <bvancea> cool 12:08 <bvancea> so, whenever you want I guess 13:15 <bvancea> heh, I think I managed to make the parser run on the default jvm memory 13:15 <bvancea> :D 13:15 <sdumitriu1> Cool 13:15 <bvancea> its slower though 13:15 <bvancea> :( 13:16 <bvancea> I probably should commit after each document 13:16 <bvancea> shouldn't* 13:17 <sdumitriu1> No, you shouldn't 13:17 <sdumitriu1> Also, Solr can be configured to autocommit 13:17 <sdumitriu1> It has soft commits which are cheap 13:17 <bvancea> yup 13:17 <bvancea> I need to check that 13:17 <bvancea> but I'll let it finish this run 13:17 <sdumitriu1> And can be enabled to automatically happen frequently, like every second 13:18 <sdumitriu1> And hard commits which are more costly 13:18 <bvancea> I'm curious about the improvement 13:18 <sdumitriu1> And can be set for ~30 seconds 13:18 <bvancea> yeah 13:18 <bvancea> I'm really curious what's the difference about them 13:19 <bvancea> my guess is that soft commits stay somewhere in ram 13:19 <bvancea> and hard commits get written to disk 13:20 <bvancea> I watched a few more videos from lucene revolution 13:20 <bvancea> I hear they're pushing solr towards a nosql store 13:20 <bvancea> not just an index 13:21 <bvancea> I was a little skeptical when I first heard it, but it sounds really nice tbh 13:22 <bvancea> yup, apparently soft commits don't flush to disk 13:58 <sdumitriu1> bvancea: Can you paste the link here, I closed the hangout and I can't access the chat from there 14:01 <bvancea> ftp://ftp.1000genomes.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/ftp/ 14:02 <bvancea> this might work faster for you ftp://ftp-trace.ncbi.nih.gov/1000genomes/ftp/ 14:03 <bvancea> the other is said to work better for europe, I selected it by mistake 14:03 <bvancea> since I was thinking that I'm in Europe 14:12 <sdumitriu1> What file should I give you... 14:12 <bvancea> are all of them huge? 14:12 <sdumitriu1> No, they're too many 14:12 <sdumitriu1> And most are not what you need 14:12 <sdumitriu1> fastq, bam 14:13 <sdumitriu1> Oh, found the VCFs 14:13 <bvancea> there's a folder with vcf files somewhere 14:14 <sdumitriu1> 11G? 3G? 1.2G? 14:14 <sdumitriu1> Pick your size 14:15 <sdumitriu1> (compressed) 14:15 <bvancea> 1.2G? 14:15 <bvancea> the compression is really good from what I've seen 14:15 <bvancea> the actual file is probably 3 times larger 14:16 <sdumitriu1> The others are for a specific chromosome 14:16 <sdumitriu1> This might be whole genome 14:16 <bvancea> hmm 14:17 <sdumitriu1> Cool, downloading at 70M/s 14:17 <bvancea> awesome internet 14:17 <bvancea> hmmm, I don't understand the error 14:28 <sdumitriu1> http://phenotips.org/downtime/ALL.chr22.phase1_release_v3.20101123.snps_indels_svs.genotypes.vcf.gz 14:28 <sdumitriu1> http://phenotips.org/downtime/ALL.chr22.phase1_release_v3.20101123.snps_indels_svs.genotypes.vcf.gz.tbi 14:28 <sdumitriu1> SELinux is a pain... 14:28 <sdumitriu1> Don't worry about the bot's error 14:32 <bvancea> 400 kbps 14:32 <bvancea> dorm internet not so awesome 14:32 <bvancea> :)) 14:33 <sdumitriu1> Well, see you in a month :)) 14:35 <sdumitriu1> How can it be so slow? 14:36 <sdumitriu1> Romania has one of the fastest connections 14:36 <bvancea> well, I dunno 14:37 <bvancea> the internet in the student dorms doesn't have that much bandwidth I guess 14:37 <bvancea> the torrent ports are closed, apparently because we'd eat eachother's bandwidth 14:38 <bvancea> should be done in about an hour anywya 14:38 <bvancea> :)) 15:19 <bvancea> so with soft commits every 1 second and hard commits every 15 seconds 15:20 <bvancea> it takes a grand total of 18 minutes 15:20 <bvancea> which is way more than I'd excepted :| 15:22 <bvancea> expected* 15:23 <sdumitriu1> Too much 15:24 <sdumitriu1> Something's wrong 15:25 <bvancea> I re-started it 15:27 <sdumitriu1> Wait, is that with the small 6M file or the 1.9G one? 15:27 <sdumitriu1> (let me know when the download is over, so I can delete the files from the server) 15:28 <bvancea> 13 minutes left 15:28 <bvancea> on the download 15:28 <bvancea> its the small 6 mb file 15:55 <bvancea> you can remove the files now 15:55 <bvancea> :)
